name: Cello - CSS
description: Cinematic Studio Strings Cello. Deep, rich tone with exceptional expressiveness. Ideal for both melodic solos and bass foundation.

legato.description: Legato is for MONO parts only - smooth transition between single notes. Enable legato (velocity ≥64) when playing single melodic lines. Disable legato (velocity <64) when 2+ notes sound simultaneously (chords, double stops). Re-enable when returning to mono. Prefer keyswitch over CC for legato control.

orchestration_hints.character: Deep, rich, vocal quality. The tenor/baritone of the string section. Extremely versatile.
best_for: Bass line foundation in string ensemble

register_character.low: C2-G2: Deep, powerful, dark. Provides bass foundation.
register_character.mid-low: G2-C4: Rich, warm, the 'heart' of the cello sound.
register_character.mid: C4-A4: Singing, expressive, ideal for melodies.
register_character.high: A4-C6: Intense, passionate, use for emotional climaxes.

ensemble_tips: In string quartet: typically plays bass or countermelody
Doubles violin melody at octave below for power
Can take over melody when violin rests
avoid: Competing with bass/contrabass in very low register
Fast passages in extreme low register (becomes muddy)
Staying too high when violin is present (register clash)

ai.system_prompt_template: Generate cello parts for Cinematic Studio Strings. Use CC1 for dynamics on long articulations, velocity for short articulations. LEGATO: Keyswitch Ab1 toggles legato (velocity ≥64 on, <64 off). IMPORTANT: Legato is for MONO parts only - use it for smooth note-to-note transitions in single melodic lines. Disable legato before any chords or double stops (2+ simultaneous notes), re-enable when returning to mono melody. Switch articulations via CC58. Playable range C2-C6, preferred C2-G5.
